question: What is Local Lense?
answer: Local Lense is a community-based news app that helps you discover and share hyperlocal content, updates, and events happening around you.

question: How do I create a new post?
answer: Tap the '+' button on the home screen or in the 'Feed' section, enter your post details, and hit 'Submit'. You can also choose a category and add images.

question: Can I edit or delete my posts?
answer: Yes, go to your profile, select the post you want to edit or delete, and choose the appropriate option from the menu.

question: Why can't I see some posts?
answer: Posts are shown based on your selected preferences, location, and following history. Try adjusting your feed settings or explore other categories.

question: Is my location shared with other users?
answer: No, your precise location is never shared with other users. It is only used to personalize your feed and improve content relevance.

question: How can I report inappropriate content?
answer: Tap the three dots on any post and select 'Report'. Our moderation team will review the post promptly.

question: Can I follow other users?
answer: Yes, you can follow users by visiting their profile and tapping the 'Follow' button. Their public posts will then appear more often in your feed.

question: Is Local Lense free to use?
answer: Yes, Local Lense is completely free to download and use. We may offer optional premium features in the future.

question: How do I reset my password?
answer: On the login screen, tap 'Forgot Password' and follow the instructions sent to your registered email.

question: Can I change my preferred news categories?
answer: Absolutely. Go to Settings > Preferences and update your preferred categories anytime.
